Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.executor.passive

Class TemporaryScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.sowide.actodes.actor.Behavior
      • it.unipr.sowide.actodes.executor.Executor<A>
        • it.unipr.sowide.actodes.executor.passive.Scheduler<SavableActor>
          • it.unipr.sowide.actodes.executor.passive.TemporaryScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public final class TemporaryScheduler
extends Scheduler<SavableActor>
    The TemporaryScheduler class uses the "cooperative scheduling" mechanism for executing SavableActor actors. It may avoid the execution of some actors when their number of idle cycles exceeds a threshold that depends on the number of scheduled actors. Such idle actors are maintained in the memory and the actor executor restarts them again when they receive some new messages from some other actors. Moreover.such a scheduler performs (if enabled) the logging of the number of running actors after the end of each scheduling cycle.
    See Also:
    SavableActor, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • registry

        protected Registry registry()
        Creates the registry managing the references of the actors of the actor space. Note the it returns an instance of the {Registry} class. Therefore, the executor actors that need a different type of registry must overridden this method.
        Overrides:
        registry in class Executor<SavableActor>
        Returns:
        the registry.
